bio:treatment.discussion: Genera ca. 50, species 2000-3000 (9 genera, 13 species in the flora):
Cassytha is sometimes placed in its own family, Cassythaceae; it is here retained in Lauraceae.

references.reference: Wood, C. E. Jr. 1958. The genera of the woody Ranales in the southeastern United States. J. Arnold Arbor. 39: 296-346.
